title: Design template component system
description: Design the component-based template system that will make templates easy for AI to create and compose. Define component structure, registration, and usage patterns.

title: Write user documentation in docs/
description: Create comprehensive user documentation including API reference, usage examples, and tutorials in the docs/ directory.

title: Implement filter pipeline parsing (|>)
description: Add filter support with pipeline operator |> for function calls like {{ value |> filter1 |> filter2 }}.

title: Design template component system
description: Design the component-based template system that will make templates easy for AI to create and compose. Define component structure, registration, and usage patterns.
design:
Component-based template system design decisions:
- Components use Capital naming (Button, not button) to distinguish from HTML elements
- XML-style syntax: <Button class=\"primary\" text=\"Save\"/>
- Components inlined during compilation (no function call overhead)
- Template string registration API
- Top-level templates compile to single functions with everything inlined
- Self-closing syntax: <Button/> for simple components, <Button></Button> for content
- Compilation: Components become inline string concatenation in final function
- ERROR SEMANTICS: Compile-time validation of component names with clear error messages
- Validation: Registry lookup during compilation, suggests corrections for typos
acceptance_criteria: Design document completed with syntax specification

title: Design comprehensive template syntax and features
description: Design the full template syntax including expressions, control flow, filters, partials, and other advanced features beyond basic variable interpolation.
design:
Template macros design:
- Skipped - components provide sufficient reusable functionality ✅
- No need for additional macro system
- Template design is feature-complete
- Focus on components for reusable UI elements

title: Implement compile-time validation and error checking
description: Add comprehensive validation during template compilation to catch errors early and provide clear error messages.

title: Implement template inheritance ({% extends %}, {% block %})
description: Add template inheritance support with {% extends "base.html" %} and {% block name %}...{% endblock %} syntax.

title: Ensure safe execution environment
description: Implement sandboxing and security measures to ensure templates execute safely without access to dangerous functions.

title: Phase 3: Compilation & Optimization
description: Optimize template compilation, add validation, and ensure safe execution environment.

title: Add performance optimizations
description: Implement performance optimizations including caching, lazy evaluation, and efficient data structures.

title: Generate optimized Lua functions for all features
description: Optimize template compilation to generate efficient Lua functions with minimal overhead for all template features.

title: Complete component-based template engine
description: Finish the template engine with component-based architecture optimized for AI development. Focus on predictable structure, minimal syntax, and composable components.
design:
Template Engine Implementation Plan:

CORE FEATURES TO IMPLEMENT:
1. Component Registration API - template.component(name, template_string)
2. Template Compilation - Convert templates to Lua functions
3. Component Inlining - Merge components into parent templates
4. Expression Parsing - Math, strings, safe navigation (?.)
5. Control Flow - {% if/endif %}, {% for/endfor %}
6. Filters - Pipeline operator |> with function calls
7. Comments - {-- comments --}
8. Advanced Variables - Dynamic property access user[key]
9. Whitespace Control - {{- -}} trimming
10. Template Inheritance - {% extends %}, {% block %}

ARCHITECTURE:
- Parser: Tokenize and parse template syntax
- Compiler: Generate optimized Lua functions
- Registry: Store component definitions
- Validation: Compile-time error checking
- Environment: Safe execution context

TESTING REQUIREMENTS:
- 100% statement coverage
- Unit tests for all features
- Integration tests for compilation
- Performance benchmarks
- Mock unsafe operations

DEPENDENCIES:
- Blocks on completed design (✅ nb-7ld)
- Requires luatest for testing
- Uses existing tokenizer foundation

CURRENT CODEBASE STATE:
- lua/nibiru/template.lua: Basic variable interpolation, compilation to functions
- lua/nibiru/tokenizer.lua: Tokenizes {{ }}, {% %}, and text
- Missing: Component system, expressions, control flow, filters, etc.

IMPLEMENTATION PHASES:
Phase 1: Core Infrastructure
- Extend tokenizer for new syntax (expressions, filters, comments, etc.)
- Build expression parser (math, strings, safe navigation)
- Create component registry system
- Implement basic component inlining

Phase 2: Control Flow & Advanced Features
- Add {% if/endif %} and {% for/endfor %} parsing
- Implement template inheritance ({% extends %}, {% block %})
- Add whitespace control parsing
- Implement filter pipeline parsing

Phase 3: Compilation & Optimization
- Generate optimized Lua functions for all features
- Implement compile-time validation and error checking
- Add performance optimizations
- Ensure safe execution environment

Phase 4: Testing & Documentation
- 100% test coverage with luatest
- Performance benchmarks
- User documentation in docs/
- Developer documentation with EmmyLua annotations

FILES TO MODIFY:
- lua/nibiru/template.lua (main engine)
- lua/nibiru/tokenizer.lua (extend for new syntax)
- tests/test_template.lua (comprehensive test suite)

QUALITY REQUIREMENTS (from AGENTS.md):
- 100% statement coverage
- Tests for all code changes
- Linting with Lua LSP
- Formatting with stylua
- Performance benchmarks
- Comprehensive error messages

title: Phase 4: Testing & Documentation
description: Complete testing coverage, performance benchmarks, and comprehensive documentation.

title: Implement {% if/endif %} control flow parsing
description: Add support for conditional rendering with {% if condition %}...{% endif %} syntax in templates.

title: Design AI-optimized Lua web framework architecture
description: Design the overall architecture for an AI-optimized Lua web framework, focusing on components that make development easy for AI systems. Cover core architecture, data handling, security, and development tools.

title: Implement {% for/endfor %} loop parsing
description: Add support for iteration with {% for item in items %}...{% endfor %} syntax in templates.

title: Improve tokenizer with attribute validation and error handling
description: Enhanced tokenizer with attribute validation and error detection. Added validate_unquoted_attribute function and malformed attribute detection. Added comprehensive tokenizer tests for component parsing.
design: Add attribute validation function in tokenizer.lua that checks unquoted attribute values for invalid characters (> " ' { }). Create special error tokens (MALFORMED_ATTRIBUTE) for invalid syntax. Improve error recovery logic to properly consume tokens when malformed syntax is encountered.
acceptance_criteria: Tokenizer correctly identifies malformed attributes and generates appropriate error tokens. Parser handles malformed attribute tokens gracefully without cascading errors. Tests pass for malformed attribute detection.
notes: Completed: Added attribute validation function, malformed attribute detection, comprehensive component tokenizer tests. Next: Implement special error tokens and improve parser error recovery.

title: Complete component-based template engine
description: Finish the template engine with component-based architecture optimized for AI development. Focus on predictable structure, minimal syntax, and composable components.

title: Implement whitespace control parsing ({{- -}})
description: Add whitespace trimming support with {{- expression -}} syntax to control whitespace around template expressions.

title: Establish implementation rules and expectations
description: Define clear rules for user docs, developer docs, testing, linting, formatting, and issue cleanup to ensure consistent high-quality implementation.
design:
Implementation rules - Issue Cleanup:
- Regular cleanup: review completed issues weekly ✅
- Status accuracy: keep current ✅
- Description updates: as understanding evolves ✅
- Duplicate removal: merge/close duplicates ✅
- Dependency management: keep accurate ✅
- Archive old issues: only with user confirmation ❌ (changed from automatic)

title: Phase 2: Control Flow & Advanced Features
description: Implement control flow statements and advanced template features for the component-based template engine.

title: Create performance benchmarks
description: Develop comprehensive performance benchmarks to measure template compilation and rendering speed across different scenarios.

title: Implement template component system
description: Implement the component-based template system with registration API, compilation, and attribute evaluation. Support <Component attr=value/> syntax with expression evaluation.
notes: Component system implementation progress: 10/14 tests passing. Added validation for malformed component tags (deferred to rendering time). Fixed test_component_missing_self_closing_tag. Remaining: handle various malformed component syntaxes and unclosed tags.

title: Add developer documentation with EmmyLua annotations
description: Add comprehensive EmmyLua annotations to all Lua code for better IDE support and developer experience.

title: Complete template engine core infrastructure
description: Finish Phase 1 of template engine implementation: extend tokenizer for advanced syntax and build robust expression parser with proper property access support. This is a focused task on core infrastructure improvements.
design:
Phase 1 Core Infrastructure:
- Extend tokenizer for advanced syntax (filters, comments, whitespace control, etc.)
- Fix expression parser bugs (property access user.name, complex expressions)
- Implement safe navigation (?.) if needed
- Ensure robust tokenization of all planned syntax elements
- Add comprehensive tests for expression parsing
acceptance_criteria: Tokenizer handles all planned syntax elements. Expression parser correctly handles property access, complex expressions, and edge cases. All expression parsing tests pass.

title: Achieve 100% test coverage with luatest
description: Write comprehensive tests to achieve 100% statement coverage for all template engine code using luatest framework.
